item.title: Leticia add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "All I'd ever wanted was to forget. but even when I thought I had, pieces had kept emerging, like bits of wood floating up to the surface that only hint at the shipwreck below." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Jane Jacobs
item.description: "Cities have the capability of providing something for everybody, only because, and only when, they are created by everybody." -- Jane Jacobs

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Jane Jacobs
item.description: "(The psuedoscience of planning seems almost neurotic in its determination to imitate empiric failure and ignore empiric success.)" -- Jane Jacobs

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Jane Jacobs
item.description:
"As children get older, this incidental outdoor activity--say, while waiting to be called to eat--becomes less bumptious, physically and entails more loitering with others, sizing people up, flirting, talking, pushing, shoving and horseplay. Adolescents are always being criticized for this kind of loitering, but they can hardly grow up without it. The trouble comes when it is done not within society, but as a form of outlaw life.
The requisite for any of these varieties of incidental play is not pretentious equipment of any sort, but rather space at an immediately convenient and interesting place. The play gets crowded out if sidewalks are too narrow relative to the total demands put on them. It is especially crowded out if the sidewalks also lack minor irregularities in building line. An immense amount of both loitering and play goes on in shallow sidewalk niches out of the line of moving pedestrian feet." -- Jane Jacobs

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Jane Jacobs
item.description: "I have been dwelling upon downtowns. This is not because mixtures of primary uses are unneeded elsewhere in cities. On the contrary they are needed, and the success of mixtures downtown (on in the most intensive portions of cities, whatever they are called) is related to the mixture possible in other part of cities." -- Jane Jacobs

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Jane Jacobs
item.description: "[Public housing projects] are not lacking in natural leaders,' [Ellen Lurie, a social worker in East Harlem] says. 'They contain people with real ability, wonderful people many of them, but the typical sequence is that in the course of organization leaders have found each other, gotten all involved in each others' social lives, and have ended up talking to nobody but each other. They have not found their followers. Everything tends to degenerate into ineffective cliques, as a natural course. There is no normal public life. Just the mechanics of people learning what s going on is so difficult. It all makes the simplest social gain extra hard for these people." -- Jane Jacobs

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Jane Jacobs
item.description: "The more successfully a city mingles everyday diversity of uses and users in its everyday streets, the more successfully, casually (and economically) its people thereby enliven and support well-located parks that can thus give back grace and delight to their neighborhoods instead of vacuity. " -- Jane Jacobs

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Jane Jacobs
item.description: "Neighborhood is a word that has come to sound like a Valentine. As a sentimental concept, 'neighborhood' is harmful to city planning. It leads to attempts at warping city life into imitations of town or suburban life. Sentimentality plays with sweet intentions in place of good sense." -- Jane Jacobs

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "Let children read whatever they want and then talk about it with them. If parents and kids can talk together, we won't have as much censorship because we won't have as much fear." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "[I]t's not just the books under fire now that worry me. It is the books that will never be written. The books that will never be read. And all due to the fear of censorship. As always, young readers will be the real losers." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "The truth will make you odd." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "you can't deny they ever happened. You can't deny you ever loved them, love them still, even if loving them causes you pain" -- Judy Blume

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "some changes happen deep down inside of you. And the truth is, only you know about them. Maybe that's the way it's supposed to be." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "We must, we must, we must increase our bust." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "Fear is often disguised as moral outrage." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "None of us really changes over time. We only become more fully what we are." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "The prince is never going to come. Everyone knows that; and maybe sleeping beauty's dead." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Consequently, if you believe God made Satan, you must realize that all Satan's power comes from God and so that Satan is simply God's child, and that we are God's children also. There are no children of Satan, really." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Come on, say it again. I'm a perfect devil. Tell me how bad I am. It makes me feel so good!" -- Anne Rice

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Goddamn it, do it yourself. You’re five hundred years old and you can’t use a telephone? Read the directions. What are you, an immortal idiot?" -- Anne Rice

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "I can’t help being a gorgeous fiend. It’s just the card I drew." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Keep your secrets Keep your silence It is a better gift than truth" -- Anne Rice

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Ignore any loss of nerve, ignore any loss of self-confidence, ignore any doubt or confusion. Move on believing in love, in peace, and harmony, and in great accomplishment. Remember joy isn't a stranger to you. You are winning and you are strong. Love. Love first, love always, love forever." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Believe in angels? Then believe in vampires. Believe in me. There are worse things on earth." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "It's an awful truth that suffering can deepen us, give a greater lustre to our colours, a richer resonance to our words." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Leticia add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi
